item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 17, 2025 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Archival Storage (133 points | 71 comments)
2. Amazon plans to lay off 14,000 managerial positions to save $3.5B yearly (63 points | 21 comments)
3. Show HN: OpenTimes – Free travel times between U.S. Census geographies (50 points | 15 comments)
4. Deep Learning Is Not So Mysterious or Different (211 points | 54 comments)
5. The High Heel Problem (34 points | 4 comments)
6. Hidden Messages in Emojis and Hacking the US Treasury (58 points | 25 comments)
7. Alphabet spins out Taara – Internet over lasers (73 points | 84 comments)
8. Luthor (YC F24) Is Hiring Ruby on Rails Engineers in San Francisco ( | hide)
9. HTTP/3 is everywhere but nowhere (278 points | 275 comments)
10. PrintedLabs – 3D printable optical experiment equipment (4 points | discuss)
11. Launching RDAP; sunsetting WHOIS (828 points | 324 comments)
12. Show HN: Localscope–Limit scope of Python functions for reproducible execution (50 points | 21 comments)
13. Wall Street’s ‘Private Rooms’ (72 points | 72 comments)
14. Dataminr tracked Gaza-related protests (103 points | 99 comments)
15. Show HN: Psychedelic animation generator; (p)art of your next trip (62 points | 29 comments)
16. Extracting content from an LCP “protected” ePub (128 points | 49 comments)
17. Coq-of-rust: Formal verification tool for Rust (103 points | 21 comments)
18. The Alexa feature "do not send voice recordings" you enabled no longer available (852 points | 602 comments)
19. Underware 2.0 – Open Source Infinite Cable Management (119 points | 35 comments)
20. Occupry your next lease to negotiate a better deal (27 points | 49 comments)
21. Stupid Smart Pointers in C (57 points | 98 comments)
22. Copyright and the Demo Scene (60 points | 14 comments)
23. Show HN: A bi-directional, persisted KV store that is faster than Redis (31 points | 53 comments)
24. The exceptional Jordan algebra (2020) (101 points | 11 comments)
25. Recommendations for designing magic numbers of binary file formats (160 points | 56 comments)
26. Chaos in the Cloudflare Lisbon Office (232 points | 112 comments)
27. Ogres Are Cool (79 points | 30 comments)
28. Undergraduate Disproves 40-Year-Old Conjecture, Invents New Kind of Hash Table (197 points | 94 comments)
29. Genomic study: our capacity for language emerged at least 135k years ago (99 points | 59 comments)
30. Conducting forensics of mobile devices to find signs of a potential compromise (135 points | 45 comments)
